SENT.plain: We report a patient who developed occasional vertigo when turning his head to the right side
Occlusion of the right vertebral artery occurred at the narrowed "scalenovertebral angle" with this rotational head movement
This triangular tunnel consisted of the hypertrophied ligament of the longus colli muscle and the anterior scalene muscle
Decompression of these extraluminal compressive factors led to relief of the symptoms
Two different kinds of extrinsic compression at the first portion of the vertebral artery are discussed
